text: The women's discus throw competition of the athletics events at the 1979 Pan American Games took place on 7 July at the Estadio Sixto Escobar.Full results The defending Pan American Games champion was Carmen Romero of Cuba. ==Records== Prior to this competition, the existing world and Pan American Games records were as follows: {| class="wikitable" |- |World record | |70.72 |Dresden, East Germany |August 12, 1978 |- |Pan American Games record | |60.16 |Mexico City, Mexico |1975 |} ==Results== All distances shown are in meters. {| class="wikitable" style="margin:0.5em auto; font- size:90%;position:relative;" width=68% |- |KEY: |align=center|WR||World Record |align=center|GR||Pan American Record |} ===Final=== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- !Rank !Name !Nationality !Distance !Notes |- | |Carmen Romero | |60.58 |GR |- | |María Cristina Betancourt | |60.44 | |- | |Carmen Ionesco | |57.14 | |- |4 |Lorna Griffin | |54.08 | |- |5 |Lucette Moreau | |52.52 | |- |6 |Lynne Winbigler | |51.66 | |- |7 |Norma Azcune | |40.36 | |- |8 |María Elena Cajigas | |38.92 | |} ==References== Category:Athletics at the 1979 Pan American Games 1979
title: Athletics at the 1979 Pan American Games – Women's discus throw
